title: Next.js build warns about workspace root detection
description: Next.js inferred workspace root from C:\Users\jason\pnpm-lock.yaml instead of the project's package-lock.json. Warning: 'We detected multiple lockfiles'. Non-blocking but noisy.
evidence: Warning: Next.js inferred your workspace root, but it may not be correct. We detected multiple lockfiles and selected the directory of C:\Users\jason\pnpm-lock.yaml as the root directory.
suggested_fix: Set turbopack.root in next.config.ts, or remove the stale pnpm-lock.yaml from home directory
suggestion_text: Accept at S3. Non-blocking warning. Fix by setting turbopack.root or removing stale lockfile.
counter_argument: The build succeeds and the warning doesn't affect output. Ignoring is safe.

title: fast-xml-parser DoS via entity expansion (high severity) in @google-cloud/storage
description: npm audit reports high severity DoS vulnerability in fast-xml-parser 4.1.3-5.3.5, pulled in by @google-cloud/storage (Cloud Functions dependency). Entity expansion in DOCTYPE without limit.
evidence: fast-xml-parser 4.1.3-5.3.5: DoS through entity expansion in DOCTYPE (GHSA-jmr7-xgp7-cmfj). Dep chain: @google-cloud/storage -> fast-xml-parser
suggested_fix: npm audit fix in functions/ directory, or pin fast-xml-parser >= 5.3.6
suggestion_text: Accept at S2. This is in a server-side dependency. XML parsing DoS requires attacker-controlled XML input to Cloud Functions, which is unlikely in this app's threat model.
counter_argument: @google-cloud/storage is a Google SDK — they'll fix this upstream. The attack vector requires crafted XML sent to storage operations, not typical for this app.

title: 26 high-severity vulns in dev/build dependencies (eslint, sentry, lighthouse, madge)
description: npm audit reports 26 high-severity vulnerabilities, all in development/build tooling: eslint ecosystem (minimatch ReDoS, ajv ReDoS), @sentry/* (minimatch via glob), lighthouse, madge, markdownlint-cli. None are in production client bundles.
evidence: 29 vulnerabilities (2 moderate, 27 high). All transitive via: eslint, @typescript-eslint/*, @sentry/*, lighthouse, madge, markdownlint-cli, c8
suggested_fix: npm audit fix for non-breaking fixes. Breaking fix requires eslint@10 upgrade.
suggestion_text: Accept at S3. All vulns are in build/dev tooling, not production bundles. ReDoS in eslint/minimatch requires crafted glob patterns in config, not user input.
counter_argument: Dev dependency vulns can affect CI pipeline security (supply chain). However, these are all well-known packages with active maintenance — fixes will come upstream.

title: No engines field in package.json — Node version not pinned
description: package.json has no engines field. Running Node v24.11.1 but no version constraint prevents accidental use of incompatible versions.
suggestion_text: Accept at S3. Low risk — the app works on v24. Adding engines is a best practice for team consistency.
counter_argument: Single-developer project. Node version is managed locally. Engines field adds maintenance overhead for minimal benefit.
